ygData.subject: removing history from NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Suppose that, instead of incrementing a global counter to assign historical markings to new genes, you just use a consistent hash function on the connection

Subject: removing history from NEAT

Suppose that, instead of incrementing a global counter to assign
historical=
 markings to new genes, you just use a consistent hash
function on the conn=
ection tuple of [in, out] ids. This would mean, I
think, that you don't hav=
e to keep a per-generation list of structural
mutations, but the historical=
 markers for matching structural
mutations will always be the same, across =
all generations.

Is there some benefit to the approach described in the NE=
AT
publications that I'm missing, or should this work fine?

One difference=
 is that you can't differentiate between disjoint and
excess genes, and so =
lose one of the c1,c2 hyperparameters =97 is this
important?
